Object.Field: RKM JDE World (JDE World JDBC Driver)

COMPONENT NAME: RKM JDE World (JDE World JDBC Driver)
AUTHOR: Oracle
DESCRIPTION: - Reverse engineering Knowledge Module to retrieve the tables for JDE World through JDE World JDBC Driver. - This RKM is suitable for JDE World installed on IBM DB2 AS400.
(From 12c onwards, all messages will appear in the Log file. The USE_LOG and LOG_FILE_NAME options are no longer required. )

DE System Short Name as (set % for all JDE System) : 00 Foundation Environment 01 Adress Book 02 Electronic Mail 03 Accounts Receivable etc ...
Or you can specify a list of modules like 01,02,03

import java.sql as sql import java.lang as lang import java.util as util import time import com.jdedwards.as400.access.JDEWJDBCConnection import com.jdedwards.as400.access.JDEWSpecTable from java.util import Properties import java.util.logging import com.jdedwards.as400.access.JDEWJDBCDriver as JDEWJDBCDriver
class odiReverse: def __init__(self, iMod, tabPattern, srcConnect,srcCatalog,srcSchema, repoConnect, logger): """ Constructor: iMod: MODEL ID value for the current Model to be reversed tabPattern: Table pattern info [Filter, TableType, AliasRemoveChars] srcConnect: Source connection repoConnect: Repository connection
Example: src = odiRef.getJdbcConnection(SRC) repo = odiRef.getJdbcConnection(DEST) imod = 5111 tabpat = ['%', 'T', 'TRG_'] rev = SnpsReverse(imod, tabpat, src, repo, 1, logfile) rev.startReverse(getcolumns=1, getkeys=1, getfks=1) rev.endReverse() """ self.logger = logger self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Reverse Started.') self.iMod = iMod
# Connect to the source database: self.srccatalog= srcCatalog if self.srccatalog=='' : self.srccatalog=None self.srcschema = srcSchema if self.srcschema == '' : self.srcschema=None
info=Properties() info.setProperty("user", "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_USER_NAME")%>"); info.setProperty("password", "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_PASS")%>");
connString ="<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_JAVA_URL")%>"; sql.DriverManager.registerDriver(JDEWJDBCDriver()) lang.Class.forName("com.jdedwards.as400.access.JDEWJDBCConnection") self.srcCx = sql.DriverManager.getConnection(connString, info);
# self.srcCx = srcConnect # Connect to the Repostory database: self.repoCx = repoConnect
# Table Pattern information: self.srctabfilter = tabPattern[0] self.tabtype = self.__gettabletype(tabPattern[1]) self.aliasremovechars = tabPattern[2] self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Reverse Options: Model %s - Filter %s - Table Types %s ' % (self.iMod, self.srctabfilter, self.tabtype)) ## # intialize source metadata ## self.metadata = self.srcCx.getMetaData() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Driver Name: %s' % self.metadata.getDriverName()) self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Driver Version: %s' % self.metadata.getDriverVersion()) self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Connection: %s' % self.srcCx.toString())
def startReverse(self, models): """ Public method to start a reverse set getcolumns, getkeys and getfks flags according to what you want to reverse """
self.__gettables(models)
def endReverse(self): """ Public Method that should be called to release all opened connections """ self.__del__()
def __getmodels(self, sysCode): """ private getmodels(): Starts the Reverse of the models """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, '*** Getting Models List **') sqltxt = 'insert into SNP_REV_SUB_MODEL (MOD_GUID,SMOD_CODE,SMOD_NAME) values (?,?,?)' ps = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqltxt) sqltxt2 = 'insert into SNP_REV_SUB_MODEL (MOD_GUID,SMOD_CODE,SMOD_NAME, SMOD_PARENT_CODE) values (?,?,?,?)' ps2 = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqltxt2) sqltxt3 = 'insert into SNP_REV_SUB_MODEL (MOD_GUID,SMOD_CODE,SMOD_NAME, SMOD_PARENT_CODE) values (?,?,?,?)' ps3 = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqltxt3) udcTable = self.srcCx.getUDCTable("98","SY")
ps.setString(1,self.iMod) ps.setString(2,sysCode) sysCodeDesc = udcTable.getUDCCode(sysCode).getDescription1() ps.setString(3,sysCode + ' --' + sysCodeDesc) ps.executeUpdate()
ps2.clearParameters() ps2.setString(1,self.iMod) ps2.setString(2,sysCode+'(T)') ps2.setString(3,sysCode+' - Data Tables') ps2.setString(4,sysCode) ps2.executeUpdate() ps3.clearParameters() ps3.setString(1,self.iMod) ps3.setString(2,sysCode+'(Z)') ps3.setString(3,sysCode+' - Z Tables') ps3.setString(4,sysCode) ps3.executeUpdate()
ps.close() ps2.close() ps3.close() self.repoCx.commit()
def __gettables(self, models): """ private gettables(): Starts the Reverse of the Tables retrieves columns, keys and fks according to the flags sent as parameters """ modules = self.__getmodules(models)
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, '*** Getting %s %s %s %s %s List **' %(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, self.srctabfilter, self.tabtype, modules))
tlst = self.metadata.getTables(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, self.srctabfilter,self.tabtype,modules) sqltxt = 'insert into SNP_REV_TABLE (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,RES_NAME,TABLE_ALIAS,TABLE_DESC_C,IND_SHOW,TABLE_TYPE,SMOD_CODE) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)' ps = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqltxt)
udcTable = self.srcCx.getUDCTable("98","SY") s_sisyr = util.HashSet() while tlst.next(): try: table_cat = tlst.getString('TABLE_CAT') except: table_cat = '' try: table_schem = tlst.getString('TABLE_SCHEM') except: table_schem = '' try: table_name = tlst.getString('TABLE_NAME') except: table_name = '' try: remarks = tlst.getString('REMARKS') except: remarks = '' ttype = tlst.getString('TABLE_TYPE') table_type = self.__gettabletype2(ttype) if self.aliasremovechars: table_alias = table_name.replace(self.aliasremovechars, '')[0:128] else: table_alias = table_name[0:128]
tab1 = self.srcCx.getTable(table_name, table_schem) sysCode = tab1.getSvrReportingSystemCode() isZTable = tab1.isZTable() sysCodeDesc = udcTable.getUDCCode(sysCode).getDescription1() if not s_sisyr.contains(sysCode): s_sisyr.add(sysCode) self.__getmodels(sysCode)
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** syscode for table: %s is %s and %s and %s **' % (table_name,sysCode,sysCodeDesc,isZTable)) self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Table: %s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s,%s (%s)' % (self.iMod, table_name, table_name, table_alias, remarks, '1', table_type,ttype)) ps.clearParameters() ps.setString(1,self.iMod) ps.setString(2,table_name) ps.setString(3,table_name) ps.setString(4,table_alias) ps.setString(5,remarks) ps.setString(6,'1') ps.setString(7,table_type) if isZTable==0: ps.setString(8,sysCode+'(T)') else: ps.setString(8, sysCode+'(Z)') ps.executeUpdate() # # Get the columns # self.__getcolumns(table_name) self.__getkeys(table_name) self.__getfks(table_name)
print s_sisyr ps.close() tlst.close() self.repoCx.commit()
def __getcolumns(self, tablename): """ private getcolumns: retrieves columns definition of a specified table """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** Getting Columns for table: %s**' % tablename) clst = self.metadata.getColumns(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, tablename, '%') sqltxt = 'insert into SNP_REV_COL (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,COL_NAME,COL_HEADING,COL_DESC_C,DT_DRIVER,POS,LONGC,SCALEC,BYTES,COL_MANDATORY,CHECK_FLOW,CHECK_STAT) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)' ps = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqltxt)
while clst.next(): colpos = 0 coltable = clst.getString("TABLE_NAME") colname = clst.getString("COLUMN_NAME") # coldt = clst.getString("DATA_TYPE") coltypename = clst.getString("TYPE_NAME") if coltypename=='CHAR () FOR BIT DATA': coltypename='CHAR() FOR BIT DATA' if coltypename=='VARCHAR () FOR BIT DATA': coltypename='VARCHAR() FOR BIT DATA' colsize = clst.getString("COLUMN_SIZE") try: colsize = int(colsize) except: colsize = None coldec = clst.getInt("DECIMAL_DIGITS") colnull = clst.getString("NULLABLE") try: colnull = int(colnull) except: colnull = clst.columnNullableUnknown try: colremark = clst.getString("REMARKS") except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> REMARKS not suported by the driver') colheading = colname if colremark: colheading = colremark[0:35] try: collen = clst.getInt("CHAR_OCTET_LENGTH") except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> CHAR_OCTET_LENGTH not suported by the driver') try: colpos = clst.getInt("ORDINAL_POSITION") except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> ORDINAL_POSITION not suported by the driver. AutoNumbering.') colpos += 1 colPos=colPos+1 try: colisnull = clst.getString("IS_NULLABLE") if colisnull=='NO': colisnull='1' else: colisnull='0' except: self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.WARNING, ' ---> IS_NULLABLE not suported by the driver. Column set to nullable.') colisnull='0'
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Column: %s, %s, %d, %s, %d, %d, %d, %s' % (colname, coltypename, colpos, colsize, coldec, collen, colnull, colisnull)) # # Apply updates to the DB # ps.clearParameters() ps.setString(1, self.iMod) ps.setString(2,coltable) ps.setString(3,colname) ps.setString(4,colheading) ps.setString(5,colremark) ps.setString(6,coltypename) ps.setInt(7,colpos) try: ps.setInt(8,colsize) except: ps.setNull(8,sql.Types.INTEGER) ps.setInt(9,coldec) try:ps.setInt(10,colsize) except: ps.setNull(10,sql.Types.INTEGER) ps.setString(11,colisnull) ps.setString(12,'1') ps.setString(13,'1') ps.executeUpdate() clst.close() ps.close()
def __getkeys(self, tablename): """ private getkeys: retrieves PK definition of a specified table """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** Getting Keys for table: %s**' % tablename) klst = self.metadata.getPrimaryKeys(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, tablename)
sqlpk = "insert into SNP_REV_KEY (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,KEY_NAME,CONS_TYPE,IND_ACTIVE,CHECK_FLOW,CHECK_STAT) values (?,?,?,'PK','1','1','1')" sqlpkc = "insert into SNP_REV_KEY_COL (MOD_GUID,TABLE_NAME,KEY_NAME,COL_NAME,POS) values (?,?,?,?,?)"
pspk = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlpk) pspkc = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlpkc)
pkname='' while klst.next(): previouspkname=pkname tablename = klst.getString("TABLE_NAME") colname = klst.getString("COLUMN_NAME") keyseq = klst.getShort("KEY_SEQ") pkname = klst.getString("PK_NAME") if not (pkname): pkname='PK_%s' % tablename
# If a new PK was detected if pkname<>previouspkname: pspk.clearParameters() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Primary Key: %s' % pkname) pspk.setString(1,self.iMod) pspk.setString(2,tablename) pspk.setString(3,pkname) pspk.executeUpdate() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Primary Column: %d, %s' % (keyseq, colname)) pspkc.clearParameters() pspkc.setString(1, self.iMod) pspkc.setString(2,tablename) pspkc.setString(3,pkname) pspkc.setString(4,colname) pspkc.setShort(5,keyseq) pspkc.executeUpdate() pspk.close() pspkc.close() klst.close()
def __getfks(self, tablename): """ private getfks: retrieves FKs definition of a specified table (Imported Keys) """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' *** Getting Foreign Keys for table: %s**' % tablename) klst = self.metadata.getImportedKeys(self.srccatalog, self.srcschema, tablename)
sqlfk = "insert into SNP_REV_JOIN (MOD_GUID,FK_NAME,TABLE_NAME,FK_TYPE,PK_CATALOG,PK_SCHEMA,PK_TABLE_NAME,CHECK_STAT,CHECK_FLOW,IND_ACTIVE) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,'1','1','1')" sqlfkc = "insert into SNP_REV_JOIN_COL (MOD_GUID,FK_NAME,FK_COL_NAME,FK_TABLE_NAME,PK_COL_NAME,PK_TABLE_NAME,POS) values (?,?,?,?,?,?,?)"
psfk = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlfk) psfkc = self.repoCx.prepareStatement(sqlfkc)
fkname='' while klst.next(): previousfkname = fkname try: fkname = klst.getString("FK_NAME") except: fkname = '' try: pktablecat = klst.getString("PKTABLE_CAT") except: pktablecat = '' try: pktableschem = klst.getString("PKTABLE_SCHEM") except: pktableschem = '' try: pktablename = klst.getString("PKTABLE_NAME") except: pktablename = '' try: pkcolumnname = klst.getString("PKCOLUMN_NAME") except: pkcolumnname = '' try: fktablecat = klst.getString("FKTABLE_CAT") except: fktablecat = '' try: fktableschem = klst.getString("FKTABLE_SCHEM") except: fktableschem = '' try: fktablename = klst.getString("FKTABLE_NAME") except: fktablename = '' try: fkcolumnname = klst.getString("FKCOLUMN_NAME") except: fkcolumnname = '' try : keyseq = klst.getShort("KEY_SEQ") except: keyseq = '' if fkname <> previousfkname: psfk.clearParameters() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Foreign Key: %s references (%s, %s, %s)' % (fkname, pktablecat, pktableschem, pktablename)) psfk.setString(1, self.iMod) psfk.setString(2,fkname) psfk.setString(3,fktablename) psfk.setString(4,'D') psfk.setString(5,pktablecat) psfk.setString(6,pktableschem) psfk.setString(7,pktablename) psfk.executeUpdate()
self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, ' Foreign Key Columns: %d, %s=%s' % (keyseq, fkcolumnname, pkcolumnname)) psfkc.setString(1, self.iMod) psfkc.setString(2,fkname) psfkc.setString(3,fkcolumnname) psfkc.setString(4,fktablename) psfkc.setString(5,pkcolumnname) psfkc.setString(6,pktablename) psfkc.setShort(7,keyseq) psfkc.executeUpdate() psfk.close() psfkc.close() klst.close()
def __getmodules(self,models): """ private getmodules: Returns the JDE System modules """ modules=[] for model in models.split(','): modules+=[model] return modules
def __gettabletype(self,tabPattern): """ private gettabletype: Returns the JDBC table Type according to the Sunopsis TYpe """ tabletype=[] for snpstype in tabPattern.split(';'): if snpstype=='T': tabletype +=['TABLE'] elif snpstype=='V': tabletype +=['VIEW'] elif snpstype=='ST': tabletype +=['SYSTEM TABLE'] elif snpstype=='AT': tabletype +=['ALIAS'] elif snpstype=='SY': tabletype +=['SYNONYM'] elif snpstype=='QE' :tabletype +=['QUEUE'] elif snpstype=='GT' :tabletype +=['GLOBAL TEMPORARY'] elif snpstype=='LT' :tabletype +=['LOCAL TEMPORARY'] else: tabletype+=['X'] return tabletype def __gettabletype2(self,tabletype): """ private gettabletype2: Returns the ODI table Type according to the JDBC TYpe """ if tabletype =='TABLE': return('T') elif tabletype =='VIEW': return('V') elif tabletype =='SYSTEM TABLE' : return('ST') elif tabletype =='ALIAS': return('AT') elif tabletype =='SYNONYM': return('SY') elif tabletype =='QUEUE' : return('QE') elif tabletype =='GLOBAL TEMPORARY' : return('GT') elif tabletype =='LOCAL TEMPORARY' : return('LT') else: return('X')
def __del__(self): """ Finalizer: Close all opened connections """ self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Disconnecting from Source.') if not self.srcCx.isClosed(): self.srcCx.close() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Disconnecting from Repository') if not self.repoCx.isClosed(): self.repoCx.close() self.logger.log(java.util.logging.Level.INFO, 'Reverse End.')

srcCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("SRC") srcCatalog= '<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_CATALOG")%>' srcSchema ='<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_SCHEMA")%>'
trgCx = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST") imod = '<%=odiRef.getModel("GLOBAL_ID")%>' tabpat = [ '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_PATT")%>', '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_OBJ_TYPE")%>', '<%=odiRef.getModel("REV_ALIAS_LTRIM")%>' ]
models = '<%=odiRef.getOption("JDE_MODULES")%>'
# # START THE REVERSE # logger = odiRef.getLogger() rev = odiReverse(imod, tabpat, srcCx, srcCatalog,srcSchema, trgCx, logger) rev.startReverse(models) rev.endReverse()
DEMO.RKM JDE World (JDE World JDBC Driver)
